reference.title: cxxFunctionScopedName
reference.shortdesc: Identifies the fully qualified scope of the function, if it is not at the global scope. The scope is the enclosing namespace/class/struct/union.

section.title: Description
section.p: The <cxxFunctionScopedName> element describes the enclosing namespace/class/struct/union. For global functions this element is empty.
See ISO/IEC 14882:2003(E) Section 3.3 Declarative regions and scopes [basic.scope]

example.title: Example
example.p: SomeFunction would have a scoped name element:
